metadata.description: Enhanced knowledge base with extracted prompt guidelines

tips: Consider viewport - may need to scale down

custom_component_height.step_1: Count the actual characters in your text
custom_component_height.step_2: Estimate line wrapping based on width and fontSize
custom_component_height.step_6: If using flexbox centering, add extra 20% to height for safety

overlap_prevention_rules: NEVER place components where: comp1.x < comp2.x + comp2.width + 40px
NEVER place components where: comp1.y < comp2.y + comp2.height + 40px
Check EVERY component against ALL others before finalizing positions
If components might touch, increase spacing or reduce sizes
Charts and images need extra 20px buffer on all sides
Text components must have minimum 40px from any edge
edge_validation_rules: ALL text components: X ≥ 80px AND X + Width ≤ 1840px
ALL text components: Y ≥ 80px AND Y + Height ≤ 1000px
Small decorative elements: Minimum 40px from any edge
EXCEPTION: Full-bleed images/backgrounds can touch edges
NEVER allow text within 60px of canvas edge

TiptapTextBlock.description: Primary text component - use for 99% of text

critical_rules.texts: Array of text objects with fontSize, color, etc.
critical_rules.height: Calculate as fontSize × 1.2 for single line

best_practices: Group related text in one component
NEVER use backgroundColor unless absolutely necessary
Combine multiple styles in texts array
Use for tables with small fonts (8pt+)

positioning_rules.always: Left or right half, never center

title_slides.split_screen_note: If split-screen is used for title, image can be on LEFT or RIGHT; choose based on composition and contrast

CustomComponent.description: ONLY for animations and special effects

critical_rules.template: function render({ props, state, updateState, id, isThumbnail }) {...}

Background.description: Start with a background - choose gradient for visual interest or solid color for minimalist design

gradient_mastery.description: Gradients create visual magic and professional polish

best_practices: NO single solid colors unless intentional minimalism
Match gradient mood to slide purpose
Test readability with your gradient choice

option_1.name: TiptapTextBlock with backgroundColor
option_1.description: TiptapTextBlock with backgroundColor (RECOMMENDED for text in shapes)

key_rules: ALWAYS use a single component when text goes inside a shape
TiptapTextBlock WITHOUT backgroundColor is the PREFERRED option for regular text
Only use CustomComponent for animated or interactive text effects
Text should be centered by default using alignment properties
Include all styling (colors, borders, padding) in the single component
AVOID decorative shapes - let content and images be the focus

dimensions: NO VERTICAL LAYOUTS! Always side-by-side with text
Chart takes exactly HALF the slide width
NEVER make a chart smaller than 800×600px!
positioning: Left side: X=80, Y=140-240, Width=880, Height=600-800
Right side: X=960, Y=140-240, Width=880, Height=600-800
NO center positioning - always pick a side!
NO full-width charts - text needs its half!

configuration.BAR/COLUMN CHARTS: MUST set showLegend: false (legends are redundant)
configuration.PIE CHARTS: MUST set showLegend: false (use data labels instead)
configuration.LINE CHARTS: Only show legends if 2+ series, otherwise showLegend: false
configuration.SCATTER/BUBBLE: MUST set showLegend: false unless multiple categories

theme_detection: If slide background is light (#FFFFFF, #F8F9FA, etc.) → use `"theme": "light"`
If slide background is dark (#000000, #1A1A1A, etc.) → use `"theme": "dark"`
If background uses accent colors → determine based on luminance

legend_rules.LINE CHARTS: Only show legend if multiple series (2+)
legend_rules.Default: When in doubt, set showLegend: false

tick_spacing.tickSpacing: Controls X-axis label skipping (1 = show all, 2 = every 2nd, etc.)
tick_spacing.tickSpacingY: Controls Y-axis label skipping (1 = show all, 2 = every 2nd, etc.)
tick_spacing.DEFAULT TO 1: Unless you have 20+ data points, always use tickSpacing of 1
tick_spacing.Maximum values: Never exceed 5 for tick spacing unless you have 50+ points

layout_patterns.Magazine Spread: Image 1200px wide, text in remaining space
layout_patterns.Masonry Layout: Multiple images, varying heights, magazine style

rules: Never set properties to null - omit them instead
Text padding must be numeric 0, not "0px"
Always use colors from the provided theme
Always use fonts from the provided theme
Shape gradients: omit if not needed, don't set to null
Lines controlPoints: must be an array of points, never null

text_on_image.technique: Image with gradient overlay, text on top

data_with_insight.layout: Chart on one half, insights on other
data_with_insight.content_strategy: Chart shows what, text explains why

split_screen.description: Text and image side by side

layouts.versus: Dramatic split with VS in center

red.cultural_notes: Lucky in China, danger in West

quality_checklist: Can it be read from back of room?

considerations: Essential info not only in animation

critical_rules_summary.height_calculation: Single line: fontSize × 1.2, Multi-line: fontSize × lines × 1.3, Always add 10-20% buffer
critical_rules_summary.chart_positioning: ALWAYS left (x=80) or right (x=960) half, NEVER center, 880px wide
critical_rules_summary.chart_legends: ALWAYS false for bar/column/pie charts, only show for multi-series line charts
critical_rules_summary.overlap_prevention: Minimum 40px gap between all components, 60px for charts/images
critical_rules_summary.edge_margins: Text must be 80px from edges, charts 60px, images can be full-bleed
critical_rules_summary.image_boundaries: CRITICAL: x + width <= 1920, y + height <= 1080. Right-aligned images: max width = 1920 - x
critical_rules_summary.shapes_with_text: ALWAYS use single component (TiptapTextBlock WITHOUT backgroundColor)
critical_rules_summary.icon_usage: Use content-specific icons from libraries (lucide, heroicons, feather, tabler), avoid generic Star/Circle, sizes: 24px inline, 32px bullets, 48px features, 72px hero

icon_comprehensive_guide.description: Complete guide for using icons effectively in presentations

implementation.render_template: function render({ props }, instanceId) { const iconLibrary = window[props.library + 'React'] || window.lucideReact; const IconComponent = iconLibrary[props.iconName]; return React.createElement('div', { style: { width: '100%', height: '100%', display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', justifyContent: 'center', color: props.color } }, React.createElement(IconComponent, { size: props.size })); }

context_matching.rule: ALWAYS choose icons that reinforce the content meaning
examples: Security feature → Shield or Lock, NOT Star
Growth metric → TrendingUp or ArrowUp, NOT Circle
Time savings → Clock or Timer, NOT generic icon

variety_enforcement.rule: NEVER use the same icon more than twice per slide
variety_enforcement.strategy: Use content-based selection to ensure variety

list_enhancements.alignment: Center icon vertically with first line

stat_displays.structure: Small icon next to large number

process_flows.structure: Icons connected by arrows or lines

themed.strategy: Match icon colors to theme palette

overuse.problem: Too many icons cluttering the slide
overuse.solution: Limit to 3-5 meaningful icons per slide

default_fallback.problem: Always using Star or Circle icons
default_fallback.solution: Choose content-specific icons from the extensive library

size_inconsistency.problem: Random icon sizes breaking visual hierarchy

poor_contrast.solution: Test contrast, add subtle shadow or outline if needed

icon_animations.entrance: Fade in or slide in with content

title_slides.if_used: Single large icon as visual anchor

feature_slides.layout: Icon above or beside feature title

comparison_slides.layout: Consistent icon placement for each option

data_slides.layout: Small icons near numbers or charts
